note.title: Resulting state for the given Controller, JOC Cockpit or Agent
note.p:
Possible values are (not case sensitive)
active>
incactive>
If the given controller in a cluster does not have the given state a switch over will be executed.
If the given JOC Cockpit in a cluster does not have the given state a switch over will be executed.
If the given agent or subagent is enabled and the given state is INACTIVE the agent will be disabled.
If the given agent or subagent is disabled and the given state is ACTIVE the agent will be enabled.

note.title: The Controller ID
note.p: The controller-id for the given JOC Cockpit, Controller or agents

note.title: The Controller host name
note.p: The controller host name for which the given state should be reached.

note.title: The JOC Cockpit host name
note.p: The JOC host name for which the given state should be reached.

note.title: List of subagent ids
note.p: A semicolon seperated list of subagent ids for which the given state should be reached.

note.title: List of agent ids
note.p: A semicolon seperated list of agent ids for which the given state should be reached.

note.title: What is the purpose of this job?
note.p: The job sets the given controller, JOC Cockpit instances, agents or subagents to a given state.
The job will consider all controllers, JOC Cockpits, agents or subagents that are specified.
